derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin vermiculatus, past participle of vermiculari 'be full of worms' (see vermicular)

means.word_mean: 1. decorate with wavy or winding lines
1. eaten (or as if eaten) by worms
2. decorated with wormlike tracery or markings;

auth_sentence.content: On their backs were vermiculate patterns that were maps of the world in its becoming.
